course_title: Advanced Special Topics in American Studies: Reparative History at Emory
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 4 / Seats Avail: 1Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as HIST 488RW 2)
(This interdisciplinary colloquium combines archival research, digital mapping, and materials and methods of Native American and Indigenous studies to investigate Emory University's history and its relationships with Native American and African American communities. With special attention to Muscogee histories of the land, place-worlds embedded within Indigenous languages, as well as entangled histories of culture and kinship with African American communities, this seminar offers students an opportunity to engage in a reparative history project and sharing that research with the Emory Libraries to build on archives and materials.)
course_description: An advanced interdisciplinary treatment of American culture issues, historical events or eras, or literature. The ILA and AMST programs support interdisciplinary inquiry of the Americas across Emory College of Arts and Sciences; this course will be frequently cross-listed with other departments.
